org.activebpel.rt.bpel.expr
Class AeAbstractBpelExpressionLanguageFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.expr.AeAbstractBpelExpressionLanguageFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeBpelExpressionLanguageFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeBPWSExpressionLanguageFactory, AeWSBPELExpressionLanguageFactory
public abstract class AeAbstractBpelExpressionLanguageFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAeBpelExpressionLanguageFactory

This implementation of the expression language factory uses the engine configuration file to map expression languages to implementations of validators and runners.

Method Detail

supportsLanguage

public boolean supportsLanguage(java.lang.String aLanguageUri)
Description copied from interface: IAeBpelExpressionLanguageFactory
Returns true if the given language is supported by this expression language factory. If null or empty string is passed in, then this method should return true if the BPEL default language is supported (xpath 1.0).

Specified by:
supportsLanguage in interface IAeBpelExpressionLanguageFactory

addLanguage

protected void addLanguage(java.lang.String aName,
                           java.util.Map aMap)
                    throws AeException
Adds a language to the factory. The map contains all of the pieces of information (found in the engine config) needed to fully describe support for a single expression language. This includes the URL of the language, its name, and implementation classes for validation and execution.

Parameters:
aMap -
Throws:
AeException

resolveLanguageUri

protected java.lang.String resolveLanguageUri(java.lang.String aLanguage)
This method resolves a language into a language URI. The value that is passed in to this method is whatever is in the 'expressionLanguage' attribute of the BPEL 'process' element. In most cases, the value of this attribute will be the URI of the language itself, so nothing is done. However, an implementation of this factory could map short names to URIs, for example. In addition, this method is used to determine the default expression language if no value is specified in the 'expressionLanguage' attribute. By default (and unless overridden in the engine config), the default language will be XPath 1.0 (as written in the BPEL spec).

Parameters:
aLanguage -
